svc@... wrote:

> It would be nice for us, if we could override the "max-document-download"
> setting, i.e have it defined pr. domain
> We are planning to crawl a bunch of domains in a single job, but need to
> set a limit to the number of objects crawled for each of the domains.
>
> This seems not to be possible in the current version of heritrix.
> Maybe this could be implemented instead as a processor.
> Suggestions are very welcome.

Take a look at the DomainSensitiveFrontier (See 
'6.1.2.3. DomainSensitveFrontier' in the User Manual 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#modules).  This 
frontier allows specification of maximum documents per domain adding a 
filter to a domain-specific override to prevent further downloads once 
the maximum has been reached.  The DSF is based on Heritrix's previous 
default frontier, the HostQueuesFrontier so your crawls will not be as 
long lasting -- but perhaps it will be sufficent to your purposes (I've 
added a feature request that we add this ability to the BdbFrontier:  
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1195298&group_id=73833&atid=539102).
